definition: lit. a notch on the side of a boat to locate a sword dropped overboard (idiom); fig. an action made pointless by changed circumstances
quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals
boat
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
variant of 劍|剑[jian4]

sentences.english: He would be milking a bull if he tried to settle the problem that way.
sentences.chinese: 他若想那样解决问题，无异刻舟求剑。

definition: to copy the way they walk in Handan (idiom)/slavishly copying others, one risks becoming a caricature
to buy a wooden box and return the pearls inside/to show poor judgment (idiom)
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
to cut the feet to fit the shoes (idiom); to force sth to fit (as to a Procrustean bed)/impractical or inelegant solution
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
lit. Lord Ye's passion for dragons (idiom)/fig. to pretend to be fond of sth while actually fearing it/ostensible fondness of sth one really fears
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition

blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
hidebound by convention (idiom)
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
lit. catch fish then forget the trap (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); fig. to take help for granted
book worship/bookishness
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
not to be taken as an example/not an example to be followed/not to be taken as authoritative
